metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4192 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
vim is vulnerable to Use After Free

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-motif - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu3').
